text: 1983 Football Championship of Ukrainian SSR was the 53rd season of association football competition of the Ukrainian SSR, which was part of the Soviet Second League in Zone 6. The season started on 25 March 1983. The 1983 Football Championship of Ukrainian SSR was won by SKA Kiev. Qualified for the interzonal playoffs, the team from Kiev did not manage to gain promotion by placing last in its group. The "Ruby Cup" of Molod Ukrayiny newspaper (for the most scored goals) was received by Kolos Mezhyrich. ==Teams== ===Location map=== ===Promoted teams=== *Nyva Berezhany - Champion of the Fitness clubs competitions (KFK) (debut) ===Relegated teams=== *SKA Kiev - (Returning after 2 seasons) *SKA Odessa - (Returning after 6 seasons) ==Final standings== ==Top goalscorers== The following were the top ten goalscorers. {| class="wikitable" |- !# !Scorer !Goals (Pen.) !Team |- |1 |Viktor Nastashevsky |align=center|41 |SKA Kiev |- |2 |Oleksandr Novikov |align=center|32 |Kolos Mezhyrich |- |3 |Pasha Kasanov |align=center|27 |Nyva Vinnytsia |- |rowspan=2|4 |Volodymyr Malyi |align=center rowspan=2|24 |SKA Odessa |- |Volodymyr Shyshkov |Spartak Zhytomyr |- |6 |Viktor Oliynyk |align=center|23 |Bukovyna Chernivtsi |- |7 |Vitaliy Dmytrenko |align=center|22 |Kryvbas Kryvyi Rih |- |rowspan=2|8 |Mykola Prystay |align=center rowspan=2|21 |Prykarpattia Ivano-Frankivsk |- |Pavlo Petrov |Atlantyka Sevastopol |- |rowspan=2|10 |Hennadiy Horshkov |align=center rowspan=2|19 |Desna Chernihiv |- | |Nyva Vinnytsia |} ==See also== * Soviet Second League ==Notes== ==External links== * 1983 Soviet Second League, Zone 6 (Ukrainian SSR football championship).
